channel.title: What OS do you use?
channel.description: What OS do you generally use? This isn't a poll because I didn't press the poll button and besides there'd be too many choices. I generally use Windows Vista/Windows Neptune [probably my favorite], and sometimes XP. I used to use Ubuntu but it just did not fit my needs [I couldn't access my school's wireless/docx/printers]. I also sometimes use DOSlike stuff. I am currently using Neptune, as well.

item.title: What OS do you use?

item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:21, topic:185038”]I’m thinking about getting linux again. I’ll probably be using it on a VPC due to lack of any more computers that I can use that aren’t involved in work/school/family. Does anyone have any suggestions? I’m thinking [K?]Ubuntu.[/quote]Try Arch first!

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: What OS do you use?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:35, topic:185038”][quote author=cooper link=topic=246760.msg2080734#msg2080734 date=1204366545]

I use quite a few actually. I have a desktop with Dual Boot Kubuntu 7.10 and Xp Black Edition V4. I also have a Desktop with Solaris Express Developer Edition, and Mandrake Linux v8.0. Then I have a Laptop with Windows Xp Professional Edition. And a couple G3 iMac’s with OS 9.1. And a G4 PowerBook with OS X Tiger. And then I have my MacBook Pro with Mac OS X Leopard. Then there’s a spare computer I used to use to host a Pirate radio, that runs 98.

Pirate radio? interesting, care to go into more detail?

Just an online radio station. My church kind of took it over, then I took it back. Used it for my own radio station. Then left it in a corner after a little while.

Your church took over your internet station? Why did they not make their own?
[/quote]

I do a lot of the IT stuff at my church. They wanted to broadcast, so broadcast we did, I let them use my PC as it was just laying around anyways.[/quote]
Oh okay. That is very nice of you

Read full topic

item.title: What OS do you use?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:34, topic:185038”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=246760.msg2080732#msg2080732 date=1204366440]

I use quite a few actually. I have a desktop with Dual Boot Kubuntu 7.10 and Xp Black Edition V4. I also have a Desktop with Solaris Express Developer Edition, and Mandrake Linux v8.0. Then I have a Laptop with Windows Xp Professional Edition. And a couple G3 iMac’s with OS 9.1. And a G4 PowerBook with OS X Tiger. And then I have my MacBook Pro with Mac OS X Leopard. Then there’s a spare computer I used to use to host a Pirate radio, that runs 98.

Pirate radio? interesting, care to go into more detail?

Just an online radio station. My church kind of took it over, then I took it back. Used it for my own radio station. Then left it in a corner after a little while.
[/quote]
Your church took over your internet station? Why did they not make their own?[/quote]

I do a lot of the IT stuff at my church. They wanted to broadcast, so broadcast we did, I let them use my PC as it was just laying around anyways.

Read full topic

I use quite a few actually. I have a desktop with Dual Boot Kubuntu 7.10 and Xp Black Edition V4. I also have a Desktop with Solaris Express Developer Edition, and Mandrake Linux v8.0. Then I have a Laptop with Windows Xp Professional Edition. And a couple G3 iMac’s with OS 9.1. And a G4 PowerBook with OS X Tiger. And then I have my MacBook Pro with Mac OS X Leopard. Then there’s a spare computer I used to use to host a Pirate radio, that runs 98.
[/quote]
Pirate radio? interesting, care to go into more detail?[/quote]

item.description:
@system wrote:

My personal favorite, http://www.mandriva.com/ (free edition, but powerpack is defiantly worth it )only one that has actually worked properly on my laptop (and has a knack for picking up drivers and things ) Though i did use Kubuntu for a few months, and that was quite good.
